comments.raw_text:
Device Maker / Manufacturer : HTC 
Device Model : Incredible S
Device OS : Android 2.3.3
Device Carrier : GrameenPhone
URL tested : Mint.com

Steps:
1. Go to Mint.com in FF beta
2. Tap on the play button of the video. 
Video is not playing

3. Go to Mint.com in default browser
4. Tap on the play button of the video. 
Video is playing

Expected:
Video should play in both ff and Android's defualt browser

Actual:
Video is not playing inf FF beta but playing in Android's default browser.

I simply hear audio but there is no video playback beyond the initial poster frame.

Build: Mozilla/5.0 (Android; Linux armv7l; rv:8.0a1) Firefox/8.0a1 Fennec/8.0a1
Device: Samsung Galaxy SII
Android: 2.3.3

comments.creator: chris@pearce.org.nz
comments.text: The video plays for me on Samsung Galaxy S1, just really really badly (like 1/10 fps). It's a YouTube video, so presumably the native browser gets served H.264 so it can use the H.264 hardware decoder on the phone. Firefox will be served WebM, which isn't currently hardware accelerated, and the software scaling will be killing performance.
